q: Donald Rumsfeld told ABC in an interview to be broadcast on`` Nightline'' Monday. President Bush has written that the troop level in Iraq was`` the most important failure in the execution of the war.'' I think that it's possible, Donald Rumsfeld responded.`` We had( an) enormous number of troops ready to go in.... You know, the path you didn't take is always smoother.'' `` We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it.'' Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. In his U.N. presentation, Colin Powell described it as Terrorist Poison and Explosive Factory, Khurmal. Rumsfeld said Khurmal was operated by Ansar al-Islam, a Sunni militant group with ties to Abu Musab al-Zarqawi , a Jordanian extremist with ties to the al-Qaida terrorist network. Michael Beschloss gave Donald Rumsfeld an opportunity at the end to explain what he'd tell a family that lost a loved one in Iraq. He answered that when he and his wife met with wounded soldiers at military hospitals: We came out of those meetings feeling inspired- not that we had helped them, but they had helped us. Indeed, Donald Rumsfeld conceded that it's hard today to give a simple explanation- as you could with World War II- what the Iraq war and related terrorism conflicts were all about.``
